imposed.title: Imposed Persona â€“ Environmental Induced Drive Structure
imposed.subtitle: Your responses show how your environment shapes your drive structure.
imposed.incomplete: Please answer all questions before saving.
imposed.error: Could not save responses. Please try again.
imposed.q1: My environment pushes me to explore new ideas.
imposed.q2: I can meet the expectation of exploring new ideas well.
imposed.q3: I wish I could put more effort into exploring new ideas.
imposed.q4: My environment pushes me to work toward clear goals and valuable outcomes.
imposed.q5: I can meet the expectation of pursuing clear and valuable outcomes well.
imposed.q6: I wish I could invest more effort into achieving concrete and valuable outcomes.
imposed.q7: My environment pushes me to be a decision maker.
imposed.q8: I can meet the expectation of taking responsibility for decisions well.
imposed.q9: I wish I could spend more effort on taking the lead or shaping decisions.
imposed.q10: My environment shares a culture that admires the pleasurable life style.
imposed.q11: I am in tune with this culture that admires a pleasurable life style.
imposed.q12: I would like to spend more time on enjoyable or pleasurable activities.
imposed.q13: My environment pushes me to care for or support people close to me.
imposed.q14: I can meet the expectation of caring and supporting people close to me well.
imposed.q15: I wish I could devote more time or effort to caring and supporting people who matter to me.
imposed.q16: My environment pushes me to maintain good relationships with peers.
imposed.q17: I can meet the expectation of maintaining good peer relationships well.
imposed.q18: I would like to put more effort into strengthening my relationships with peers.
imposed.q19: My environment pushes me to act in ways that reflect my beliefs.
imposed.q20: I can meet the expectation of acting in line with my beliefs well.
imposed.q21: I wish I could devote more time or energy to activities that align with my beliefs.

surface.title: Surface Persona Test
surface.subtitle: Reflecting on your real world motivations.
surface.incomplete: Please answer all questions before saving.
surface.error: Failed to save. Please try again.

q1.prompt: Between the following two jobs, I would choose:
q1.a: a job that lets me explore new ideas
q1.b: a job that leads to clear and valuable rewards

q2.prompt: Between the following two roles, I would choose:
q2.a: a role that allows me to explore unfamiliar ideas
q2.b: a role where I take charge of making important decisions

q3.prompt: Between the following two lifestyles, I would choose:
q3.a: a lifestyle that gives me time to explore new ideas
q3.b: a lifestyle centered on enjoyable or relaxing activities

q4.prompt: Between the following two paths, I would choose:
q4.a: a path that lets me explore new ideas
q4.b: a path focused on caring for people who matter to me

q5.prompt: Between the following two lifestyles, I would choose:
q5.a: a lifestyle that allows me to explore new ideas freely
q5.b: a lifestyle that helps me maintain relationships with peers

q6.prompt: Between the following two commitments, I would choose:
q6.a: pursuing new questions that interest me
q6.b: engaging in activities that align with my core beliefs

q7.prompt: Between the following two paths, I would choose:
q7.a: a path where I am focused on caring for people important to me
q7.b: a path that focuses on concrete, valuable achievements

q8.prompt: Between the following two jobs, I would choose:
q8.a: a job that allows me time to care for people important to me
q8.b: a job where I make the final decisions

q9.prompt: Between the following two lifestyles, I would choose:
q9.a: a lifestyle centered around caring for people important to me
q9.b: a lifestyle centered on enjoyable or relaxing activities

q10.prompt: Between the following two commitments, I would choose:
q10.a: maintaining strong connections to friends and peers
q10.b: working toward clear rewards or achievements

q11.prompt: Between the following two roles, I would choose:
q11.b: taking charge of directing the course of action

q12.prompt: Between the following two lifestyles, I would choose:
q12.a: feeling close and connected with friends and peers
q12.b: enjoying a comfortable and relaxing lifestyle

q13.prompt: Between the following two choices, I would choose:
q13.a: spending time on activities that promote my core beliefs
q13.b: working toward goals that bring clear rewards

q14.prompt: Between the following two approaches, I would choose:
q14.a: staying loyal to my core beliefs
q14.b: stepping up to direct the decisions being made

q15.prompt: Between the following two lifestyles, I would choose:
q15.a: expressing and acting on my values
q15.b: engaging in enjoyable or pleasurable activities

q16.prompt: Between the following two lifestyles, I would choose:
q16.b: achieving goals and having a productive life

q17.prompt: Between the following two social focuses, I would choose:
q17.a: nurturing deep, intimate relationships with those closest to me
q17.b: fostering a sense of belonging and connection within my circle of peers

q18.prompt: Regarding my influence on others, I find that:
q18.a: I am most comfortable leading in my private, personal life
q18.b: I am most comfortable taking charge in professional or group settings

q19.prompt: Regarding my social connections, I prefer:
q19.a: having a few deep, intimate bonds with individuals
q19.b: belonging to a larger, active circle of friends and peers

q20.prompt: When it comes to my energy, I feel most recharged:
q20.a: through quiet reflection or sensory pleasure in a calm space
q20.b: through active social engagement and high-energy environments

innate.title: Innate Persona Test
innate.subtitle: The fundamental architecture of your core instinct.
innate.incomplete: Please answer all questions before saving.
innate.error: Failed to save. Please try again.
innate.q1: I would choose to explore new ideas, even if doing so does not guarantee strong accomplishments.
innate.q2: I would choose to explore new ideas, even if it limits my ability to lead the group in making important decisions.
innate.q3: I would choose to explore new ideas, even when it is not especially relaxing or comfortable.
innate.q4: I would choose to explore new ideas, even if it does not allow me to stay connected with my peers.
innate.q5: I would choose to explore new ideas, even if it reduces my sense of connection with people who matter to me.
innate.q6: I would choose to explore new ideas, even if they do not fully align with the moral values I hold.
innate.q7: I would support my peers, even if it means having less time for comfort or relaxation.
innate.q8: I would seek roles where I make the important decisions for the group, even if this reduces the time I can devote to people important to me.
innate.q9: I would continue focusing on producing meaningful results, even when doing so prevents me from spending time with people I care about.
innate.q10: I would stay closely connected with peers, even if doing so limits the time I can dedicate to achieving clear accomplishments.
innate.q11: I would choose to take charge of group decision-making, even if that weakens some of my relationships.
innate.q12: I would stay connected with people important to me, even when that reduces my time for relaxation or enjoyment.
innate.q13: I would work toward valuable achievements, even when doing so limits my ability to fully act according to my moral beliefs.
innate.q14: I would take on roles that allow me to direct the decisions of a group, even if that prevents me from acting according to my moral values.
innate.q15: I would stay committed to my moral values, even when this requires giving up comfort or enjoyment.
innate.q16: I would focus on achieving goals, even when this requires giving up comfort or enjoyment.
innate.q17: I would rather spend time with people important to me, even if it means giving up time socializing with friends.
